summary: This document is an email chain from March 2020 between attorney Bruce Barket and an unidentified recipient, discussing preparations for an upcoming court appearance and requests related to client Nicholas Tartaglione, including viewing evidence from a suicide attempt, touring the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), and arranging a family visit.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione, making requests to view evidence, tour the MCC, and arrange a family visit for his client.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Tartaglione'; the client for whom Bruce Barket is requesting a family visit and legal preparations.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is acting as legal counsel for Nicholas Tartaglione, making requests on his behalf related to evidence viewing and prison visits.

events.title: Requested Family Visit for Tartaglione
events.description: Bruce Barket requested a family visit for his client Nicholas Tartaglione at the MCC, scheduled for the day after a court appearance.

events.title: Upcoming Court Appearance
events.description: Mention of a court appearance scheduled for March 4, 2020, the day before the requested family visit.

events.title: Suicide Attempt at MCC
events.description: Reference to a suicide attempt that occurred on July 23, 2019, for which Bruce Barket seeks to view the physical evidence.

locations: 666 Old Country Road, Ste. 700, Garden City, NY 11530
keyFacts: Attorney Bruce Barket was actively preparing for legal proceedings involving his client Nicholas Tartaglione in March 2020.
Barket sought to view physical evidence from a July 23, 2019 suicide attempt at the MCC, indicating an investigation into jail conditions or events.
The email chain shows coordination for a family visit for Tartaglione and a planned tour of the MCC cells, suggesting concerns about client welfare or case preparation.
The correspondence is marked as potentially confidential attorney-client communication, highlighting the legal nature of the discussions.
